items.title: 'Gone off like a rocket': Households cash in on battery rebate
items.description: Battery uptake is booming since the federal government rebate came into effect in July. Here's what you need to know if you are thinking of joining the thousands of Australians adding a battery to their home solar systems.

items.title: What happened when we tested a new therapy chatbot
items.description: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

items.title: Russia claims Ukraine targeted Putin residence with drones
items.description: Russian state media reported the claims from foreign minister Sergei Lavrov, who said the country's negotiating position on achieving peace in Ukraine would change as a result of the attack.

items.title: Big bank convinced watchdog to delay revealing damaging news
items.description: The Commonwealth Bank persuaded a key regulator to delay announcing it had broken spam laws until after its AGM, new documents reveal.

items.title: ASIC's remarkable turnaround as the tiger that found its teeth
items.description: After 20 years in the wilderness, the Australian Securities and Investments Commission's rehabilitation as a law enforcement agency seems almost complete.

items.title: A cyclone, the mushroom killer and terror at Bondi: Your most read stories
items.description: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

items.title: Cyclone Hayley strengthens as it closes in on Kimberley coast
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Hayley is upgraded to a category four system as it nears the northern WA coast.

items.title: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker
items.description: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

items.title: Josh Burns on juggling politics, fatherhood and being a Jewish MP
items.description: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

items.title: Inside south-east Queensland's largest water reservoir Wivenhoe Dam
items.description: South-east Queensland's largest water reservoir provides drinking water and protection from flooding. So, how does it all work?

items.title: Your soft plastic bags can once again be recycled. Here's how
items.description: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

items.title: US offers Ukraine 15-year security guarantee as part of peace plan
items.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has held talks with US President Donald Trump, and says he would prefer a commitment of 50 years.

items.title: Outback city rumbles through a record year of ground shaking
items.description: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

items.title: How history nearly repeated for a Beatle at the hands of a troubled fan
items.description: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, Harrison survived the attack by a knife-wielding attacker, though Harrison's friends and family speculated it ultimately hastened his death less than two years later.

items.title: Were you paying attention to the big scientific discoveries of 2025?
items.description: From dire wolves to dementia risk, this quiz will test your knowledge on some of the biggest science news stories of the year.

items.title: Remembering the celebrities and public figures who died in 2025
items.description: From actors and designers to a Holocaust survivor and a broadcaster, these people made their mark.

items.title: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed who wrestled gunman shares his story
items.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

items.title: PM announces terms for review of Bondi terror attack
items.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

items.title: ICC hands down punishment for 'unsatisfactory' MCG pitch
items.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

items.title: Family, colleagues in 'disbelief' after leading scientist dies aged 52
items.description: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

items.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days
items.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

items.title: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing
items.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

items.title: Hamas confirms death of former leader, believed to have died in May
items.description: In a statement, the Palestinian militant group also confirmed the death of spokesman Abu Ubaida.

items.title: Certainty in the rearview mirror as 2025 economy goes wild
items.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

items.title: Stranded passengers to fly home from PNG after failed efforts to free cruise ship
items.description: Passengers on the Australian cruise ship stranded off the coast of Papua New Guinea will be flown out of the country after efforts to refloat the vessel failed.
